number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 5, 2016
												If you happen to see this game on sale with the DLC pretty cheap, pick it up.First, addressing all the Non-recommended reviews:The community is small but pleasant most of the time, and the developers are working and responding to how the community wants to shape the game.Yes they try new things, and yes they mess it up sometimes. But if the community doesn't like it then it gets revoked and they take a step back. Mana System is not bad at all despite what people make it out to be. There are bugs that people happen to lose their relics and then come write a negative review instead of troubleshoot the problem with developers. You should also note the date of most of the (Helpful Reviews) are from more than two months ago (with exception).The game itself (As of February 5th 2016)PROS -------------------- Latest update has smoothed gameplay a lot- If you are in the U.S. they just added dedicated servers so multiplayer is a lot more playable with other people. (Other dedicated servers are in Germany, sorry Asia dwellers)- Community is small and you'll make friends fast- Gameplay is pretty fun, loot system lets you pick up gear and there is a decent (albiet small and not too variable) skill    system.- Wave System allows you to control what comes at you, enemies are now released in packs that speed up gameplay.- Endless Level Wormhole lets you put your gear to the test with enemies that scale up a lot.CONS ----------------------- Siege Mode doesn't let you skip waves at the moment.- There is a relic that when you pick it up and exit game, causes all your relics to disappear.- Sometimes devs try something out that everybody hates and you have to wait a while for them to revert the changes.- Sometimes crashes unexpectedly, annoying but boots right back up quickly, doesn't have any extremely negative results from the crash (loss of items, gold, etc.) from what I've seen so far.- Active Relics (kind of like skills you have to activate) are way less powerful than Passive ones.I'll update with more as the game progresses, but it is very much playable in it's current state and quite fun despite what others think. If you got more than a full day in game time, I'd say you have gotten your money's worth.

content:
Posted: June 14, 2014
												Hero Siege is a really fun Rogue-like RPG,with some unique elements to it.It differs from from the ''room-after-room'' template and has 100+ different and unique to each other stages,all filled with countless waves of monsters for you to kill.It is very action packed,but has a slight strategic element to it,allowing you to build your character the way you want to,instead of being linear in terms of progression.Unfortunately,no game is perfect.If you do choose to pick this game up(and i recommend you to do),expect a few of your runs to end unexpectedly.At the current state of the game,there are a couple of ways you can almost instantly die,no matter where you are,or at what stage/difficulty you are on.Furthermore,the successfulness of your run heavily depends on the items you get,and not so much on your character and the way you have built him(Your character's and your own skill can't take you to the endgame without some items to back you up).The lack of tutorial is a double-edged sword,since even if you cant understand anything about the game from the start,it is verry fun to learn everything yourself.Overral,i would reccomend buying this game if you want a way to waste your free time.It doesn't contain micro-transactions and has more than a lot of potential,so that's a plus in my books.At it's current state you can't play it ''full-time'' but it's hella fun to play when you have nothing else better to do(it's better that shooting birds at pigs while waiting for the bus at least).8/10 For this one

content:
Posted: January 10, 2016
TL;DR Rating:[3/5]  "Fun but Flawed"-Buy when it goes on saleSo, this game is a Twin-Stick-Shooter that is basically a mash up of Diablo and The Binding of Isaac. It has the persistence of gear you equip that is permanent between deaths, and the rogue-likeness of relics that you collect that add effects or massive stat increases and randomized potions that act on your current run ONLY.Graphics: Solid, vibrant sprites, pretty much what you would expect of it.Sound: OK, the voice-overs are amatuer and the BG music is bland and repetitive, but the sound effects are decent.Controls: Responsive and intuitive, good controller support, but some controler functions overlap in menusDLC Content: Unfortunately, half of the game is locked behind "DLC" including later acts and classes. If you are on the fence, buy the base game and try it before you buy the rest.Gameplay: ....Ok here is where things get dicey. I really want to love this game more but....The bugs.... god the bugs... This is a game that has (had?) so much potential but I feel like the enourmous list of unfixed bugs is really holding it back. Many have pointed out that the devs have almost abandoned this game, and it is kinda true. They do still fix things here and there but the backlog of documented bugs is astounding. Some you can exploit to power up, some exploit YOU and ruin your run. This is not an early access game, but if you buy it expect all the things that you would expect of an early access game. Its pretty buggy.Class balance is pretty... unbalanced. It becomes clear very quickly which classes are god-like and which are terrible. That doesnt mean they are un-playable, but dont expect to be on equal footing in the higher difficulties.Multiplayer is one of the main draws of this game, but you will need to port forward to host, and the dedicated servers are restricted to Europe. On top of that, the multiplayer server hub system seems to crash often, and player hosted games can also crash for no appearant reason.Items (relics) are somewhat bland, many are blatent clones of The Binding of Isaac items, some are utterly trash, and some really dont make any sense functionally or thematically.NOW DESPITE ALL THAT... I still like this game. This is a nice little loot-grind shoot-em-up and its fun to play with friends or randoms, you get to feel pretty powerful and awesome when you start getting gear and mowing down dozens of enemies at the same time and there are hella explosions and huge damage numbers. It is definitely fun, but at the normal price it is probably not worth it. It has too many bugs and not enough dev support to warrent a full price purchase. If you like the genre, then buy when and if it goes on sale again.

content:
Posted: December 14, 2014
												There might be some kind of awesome endgame experience I'm totally missing out on, but the first few hours in this game are terrible and didn't leave me wanting more. I'm not sure they balance tested the singleplayer; or at least not the early game.Starts off nearly impossible. You do practically no damage and every level up feels like a joke; with each stat point giving maybe a 0.5% increase in your damage or attack speed (You only get 2 points to spend per level). Statues on the map spit shots which kill new players in one or two hits and they're sometimes hidden by enemies, grass, or trees so you're often clueless about how you died.The game is miserly with any loot as well. It wasn't until my 25th run that I even knew the game had items at all. You pick up gold but it can't be spent unless you also figure out that you need to save a key and hope that a "Treasure Fort" randomly spawns. Items are only available through locked chests (for which keys are very rare), shops (Also needs a key), or by beating a boss which I wasn't able to manage until at least by 30th run. By this time my character was level 10.Binding of Isaac gives you a gimme floor to start you off and hands you a free item in the first 2 minutes so you know what the game is about; Dispite drawing heavy influence from it, this game seems to miss that critical concept.

So they broke the game with updates and I have yet to play a session where I do not get bumped out for "Fatal Memory Error." Pretty disappointing, as the game was a lot of fun initially, even for quite a long time.ALSO WORTH NOTING, the developer does not care about the bugs or the feedback from players, as can be seen in many of the reviews on here. Bottom line: Do Not Get This Game

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 13, 2016
Short versionThis is a wonderful quick-fix for Diablo 2 fans, and for the money you'll get a solid deal.  Don't expect an incredibly deep game or story, and don't expect something truly amazing - this won't be a game you keep coming back to years later.  But for what it is, it's a fair deal and it's definitely worth the price.Pros:- Local co-op, always a big plus in my book.- Random loot, random levels, and lots of difficulty options after you "win", offering a fair bit of replayability.- The first two DLCs added enough fun that I don't consider them a waste of money (this is rare in my book).- There are a lot of interesting classes out of the box even if you don't bother with DLCs.- You can reset skills, but the cost is high enough to make you have to think about it.Cons:- The loot system feels all wrong to me - by level 50 I'm still finding that my level 20 gear is better than anything I've found since.  I expected something more like Diablo 2 or Borderlands where a white level 50 is far beyond any level 20 item.  It seems like loot level has very little to do with loot quality, which makes the item hunt boring fast.- Does gold ever matter?  I thought D2's gold system was broken....- The game becomes a grind very quickly - I'm not sure I'll bother playing anymore, though I do want to know if loot ever catches up with my level.- There are a variety of annoying bugs, like loot dropping in places you can't reach.  If loot mattered more, this could be tragic.- The game is incredibly non-intuitive.  You really have to work to learn how to play.- There's effectively no story to speak of.- Many skill synergies feel forced and/or meaningless.- Many skills feel forced and/or meaningless.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 21, 2015
												Essentially, this game reminds me a lot of Diablo 2. It has a lot of different classes you can play. Theres loot drops, gold drops, hp/mana drops, and potion drops that do things to your stats. You have a skill tree and attribute points to distribute however you please. The game is played in waves and you use portals to get to the place with the waves, and in/out of town. A nice feature of this game is the online play with server lists. However, I have a lot of issues connecting to other peoples servers even though I have a great internet connection. Its a fun game, and cheap too. I believe this game has been in game bundles before (I think thats how I got it), so its definitely worth it to try it out if its sitting in your library or on sale for cheap.

Posted: January 3, 2016
												Fun casual madness. Reminds me of the sidescroller games, or smash tv.Graphics is cute, gameplay is fun, everything has special mechanics that you need to learn to get good at this game.If you like playing laid back games with friends without too much at stake, this is the game for you.Currently the developer(s) are having some server issues with multiplayer. number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2015
												Anything by panic art studios has been good so far.  I always somehow manage to get their great titles. and my computer never has issues running them. Even at 60FPS.This game is great, taking tower defense to a fun level. It reminds me of early flash games, only way more beefed out. While it may copy off of binding of issacs controls, thats where the similarities to the game really do end. You can upgrade your character, and its not that hard to do it either. I don't really know what else to say other than "JUST DO IT." "NO, WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR?"EDIT: I saw the negative reviews and played the game more recently. It has issues, but put this into perspective: Most triple A titles are lucky to be WITHOUT issues. so why are you guys complaining some indie game has them? Going as far as calling the developers incompetent fools? Honestly i don't see where the negative reviews are coming from, even after the new update. This isn't panic art studios only good title. Squishy the suicidal pig is another one i have to reccomend, and that one has no issues, so it just seems like people aren't doing their research, and are just jumping ship to say the developers are terrible. Far from it.

content:
Posted: March 3, 2016
												I just bought the game and have played a decent amount of time and in all fairness it's a wonderful game. The ram required is no joke for how many projectiles and effects can be going at once, which makes the game look amazing. The controls are a little hard to manage with but you'd get used to them quickly, other than the space and enter key switching from time to time. The bosses are really cool and strong if you're not prepared so this makes things challenging. The voices and dialog from the characters are amazing. (The Necromancer just sound amazing and dark) The game has quite simple to grasp gameplay and directions on how to do some things such as unlocking golden chests. A lot of really cool enemies are in the game. And to top it off there are tons of really amazing skills In the end I'd give this game a 9/10 because of the lag that can occur from massive particle amounts but other than that the game is awesome espicially since it's got multiplayer, just think of a top down COD 2 Zombies with fantasy elements. Enjoy the game and thank you to the developers for making this game.

content:
Posted: July 1, 2015
												So far throughout my experience playing this game I've had a blast! The multiplayer is a ton of fun especially when you get to play with your friends and just slay tons and tons of monsters over and over. The game is still pretty early in development so it has its issues. I would tell anyone to give this game a try and don't worry about the bugs, they're basically part of the game right now. All in all, it's a great game. -Pros - Great replay ability- 4 Player Co-op (great for friends)- Ranking system (challenge your friends)- Devs are constantly at work improving the game and adding DLC- DLC and extras are pretty cheap- Helpful community -Cons - A lot of bugs, not as many anymore (devs and community are working hard to fix them)- Server connectivity, the server drops every now and then but almost never happens.- Community complains about everyone wrong with the game.- Servers are self hosted, requires port forwarding.

content:
Posted: June 29, 2015
												Interested in Roguelike games or 2-D low resolution games?So that's it.Wanna suffer lethal traps  and tons of  combat damage in early stages and be invincible in later stages?So that's it.Dying to try  10 different characters ,physical,magical,mixed?So that's it.6/10 Really?Here goes the point.Yes,you may have heard of random traps ,random bosses etc,BUT the general terrain issettled.After finishing normal level,you unlock nightmare,then,try to play the whole 6 stages again with familiar terrain.If you're ok with that.Go ahead,play hell level and more levels to unlock!Geez.So many levels and even hardcore mode.Can anyone bear this?Such a waste of time.It's my first time to play roguelike game,so I'm not sure whether others have same settings."Sigh"According to my experience,you can reach lvl100 at nightmare Stage 6.Unbeatable.Your stats will be stacked by 1000+ with numerous potions and relics.By the way,relics are not helpful at any time.Example,some of them could increase your strength and decrese your armor  and swiftness.Remember,your stats can be under zero!If you are a melee in early stages,then good luck XDDD. There are several screenshots, you may surf my page(no idea how to post a link).Why I post 10 characters?Cuz in most conditions I just set up a file to check the skills and no further try,which means I don't know exactly the number.LOLAll in all,I suggest firstly choosing a ranger(magician&archer&shooter),reach lvl 100,and one more melee to start again if you like.Don't even think about trying Viking firstly,or you must be ____ed up(no idea how to type heart like others either)Don't even think about full achivements-no way if less than 100hrs were spent. One more to go,I'm an ordinary student who just passed CET6,so sry for any potential mistake. If you have any problems or questions,plz let me know.

content:
Posted: August 27, 2015
												A terrific game. It's very laid back and the motto of the game? The more the merrier. Yes the multiplayer isn't the greatest although i can see the devs are trying their best to fix it (and it's paying off!) so play with lots of friends and with that trading system their implementing you will no longer have to be that guy who gets money at the end of each round! And you'll really be able to sharpen your classes being able to trade with your friends (i'm assuming you can trade relics).So if you don't like this game for a certain reason don't let your 5 quid go to waste, watch the game you may just like it more in a month or two.Great little game worth the money 8.5/10

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 22, 2015
												Do you enjoy Binding of Isaac's feeling of Random items and the joys of finding that one item that you have no idea what it does? Do you enjoy the Hack n Slash of games like Diablo? Hero Siege puts both of these features in one amazingly fun game. Solo or with friends you will enjoy the game if you are a fan of Hack n Slash games.There are many Characters to choose from Ranging from Tanks to pure Damage Dealers.The Art work I fell in love with back when I found the game on the Google Play Store.The game has that crazy feeling of "what am I getting this wave" or "Oh no Not this enemy again".The game got many updates that did kind of In my opinion did dumb down the difficulty a lot.Multiplayer is a blast with friends,The game does get harder with more players but that makes the gameplay and the core of what the game was really fun. The DLC's are cheap and add a lot to the game. 5 New Characters, 3 New Chapters. New Items. New Enemies. The final act is actually quite a challange.If I had to rate the game..I'll give it about an 8/10.A few bugs in multiplayer are kind of annoying but are avoidable.All around I love the game and I support the developers with this great game they made and games they are going to make in the future!

content:
Posted: November 13, 2014
												Like Binding of Isaac, be prepared to die.  A lot.   Despite knowing that, I have had few (if any) RageQuit experiences.  It's just plain fun.  And addictive.  Yeah, there are bugs in the game but each update I find fewer and fewer of them.  The Dev actually listens to the players (mostly) in regards to recommendations.  If the Dev disagrees with a recommendation, there is plenty of forum communication stating WHY.This is how indie games should be done.I currently have a level 25 Necromancer and despite that, I find new things abou the game each time I play.  If you enjoy roguelikes, retro ARPG's, and have a bit of a masochistic side (as most roguelike players do), the game is totally worth it.

												I love this game! It's a great throwback to the graphics and simple RPG elements of olde. The added rogue-like element was the perfect thing for this style of game; it really brings it all together. My one complaint is that nearly 5 times now I've made quite some progress, and out of nowhere a "thing", I have no idea what, falls on my head and kills me instantly, forcing me to restart act 1 over and over. There's no warning, no shadow or anything; it just comes completely out of nowhere. Otherwise, amazing game, 9 out of 10 :)

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 11, 2014
												A perfect blend of Binding of Isaac and Rogue Legacy, with enough traps to excite Admiral Ackbar. Defeat waves of enemies in five fixed waves leading up to a boss wave on level six. Treasure, and deities are randomly generated each wave to add potions and relics as well as temporary or permanent stat boosts/reductions.  From what I see there are threes stages but I've only made it to wave 26-30 before being killed by a trap I overlooked consecutive times. Challenging and addicting just like the two games mentioned previously. Highly recommended for fans of both.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2015
												I don't really understand a lot of these negative reviews.I think the new item systerm is awesome, though the interface for it is pretty clunky at first until you understand what you're loooking at.  Obviously you can't get the best items without buying the dlc....that would be dumb, I don't want a dlc that provides no progression for my characters. Also the infamous mana update isn't as bad as people are making it out to be. Basically they significantly decreased the amount of mana in your pool, but honestly, I like this update. The game would've been way way way to easy with items if you could also infinitely spam all of your skills.My only gripe about this game is i pretty regularly get a very brief, very subtle screen freeze when killing a boss, or if I kill a large amount of monsters at once. It is'nt bad at all and doesn't even bother me unless I just so happen to be standing in the wrong spot and I die because of it.All in all the game is awesome and easily worth ther very cheap price tag. The dlc are only $3 each which are all also very much worth that. 8.5/10

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 30, 2014
												Elements of Binding of Isaac mixed with a very, very watered down Diablo 2?/3 makes Hero Siege.+ Cheap game~ Graphics are clean, somewhat- Controls best with a controller unfortunately (I had a controller anyway, but still)- Getting hit with hard-to-notice-projectiles amongst the busy (sometimes VERY busy) graphics- Cheap deaths ranging from enemy's death shooting a laser to environmental traps- Simplistic and unimaginative skills (all classes have multiple "% to cast when attacking" skills)- Terrible netcode for multiplayer (Why have it in a DLC if it's so terrible?)- Levels are all the same with little variation- Stat levels you gain from levelling mean very little- "Relics" (which are items that grant different effects you carry with you) are mostly unimaginative stat boosts- Bosses that appear after 6 waves do not scale with # of waves and are completely boring/easy (although how boring fighting these bosses are, this may be a good thing)- The only break from monotony are dungeons/crypts which are deathtraps (see: environmental traps)- Grindy with little rewardIn summary: the game's exceedingly cheap deaths, repetitive gameplay, and banal character skill trees make this game very difficult to recommend to even the most autistic player.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2014
												Traps. Everywhere. They will spawn on top of you or behind things you can't see and kill you. Constantly. In one hit. Even if you're a tank who's invested his skill points soley in not dying.The game would actually be relatively fun otherwise, and I understand from long time players that months ago this was not the case, but you will only be playing in areas where the creeps and bosses pose little to no challenge just so you can possibly survive one hit for a trap or bomb (which detonate randomly when you kill enemies) and scuttle away to hopefully find some life. If you can't find enough before the next trap gets you, too bad. Back to the beginning. Of the act.Also at the moment there is no multiplayer if you don't buy dlc, just as a warning to any potentially mislead perspective buyers. The implication also seems to be that new things will only come to dlc owners now, which may not be the case, but the deliberately vague wording leaves me suspecting otherwise.Despite its seeming simplicity it might have actually been worth full price if not for the things I mentioned. It might have been like a SNES Diablo. Instead it's like a SNES Diablo where any enemy could be an undercover creeper and any wall or tree could be an out of bounds trap waiting to shoot bombs at you. Also your loot is deleted when you die in one hit to those things. Also your SNES is on the internet and they gouge you for dlc if you want basic features.8/10, would do drugs to forget.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 18, 2014
												Definitely a very fun game! It does get frustrating because if you die you have to start all over, luckily your character lvl remains the same, but all your items and gold disappear. The potions are overpriced and they get more expensive, which makes it even harder as you go along.The local co-op is still in beta, and while very fun, there are still bugs. I lost a lvl 12 character file, but I knew the risks when we started up the local co-op. The local co-op is very fun, but for me it crashes when both characters die and I hit restart. Local co-op is REALLY fun!The developers have announced that the next update will be on 4/24/14 and that many of the bugs have been fixed. Online multiplayer is being worked on.While the game still has bugs to work out, and it can get pretty frustrating sometimes, it's a great, fun game and has a LOT of potential once all the bugs are worked out.I would appreciate it though if there were an 'easy' mode in which you don't lose all your items, or the potions are cheaper, or both.Despite its flaws, I highly recommend this game.

content:
Posted: March 19, 2016
												I've been playing this game for a good time now and would like to list the pros and cons of the game to people looking for a new game or to have good time. so let's get right to it.-Pros:-A mix between Diablo and The Binding of Isaac, both very enjoyable games-Classes are all fun to play with a good-ish amount of skills-Relics are rewaring and useful-Armor is the same-DLC Classes and Acts are useful and fun respectively-Cons:-You can get one-shotted on later difficulties-Crashes every hour or so-After losing your relics very hard to build back up -Some enemy champions and mini-bosses are so OP (a.k.a. Electrified and The Necronomicon)-Traps can literally wreck you without a moment's notice-Skills sometimes don' work-Mana costs for abilities don't scale well-Servers sometimes are useless so you are forced to port forwardTL; DR Buy this game if you can deal with bugs and are patient enough to wait for patches. Don't buy this game if you have issues with balance of enemies and items, crashing, high mana costs, and buying DLC.P.S. If you agree with some of my cons please help me get the developers to see this so they can improve the game and make it more enjoyable.

												It may not be a Diablo or a Torchlight but what it is shines brightly. This game is a labour of love hand-crafted by a small group of devs with a passion for the genre, their constant, sleep-deprived effort to keep this game running and regularly updated is extremely appreciated. number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 24, 2016
												When I first got this game it was fun, but after the Devs started changing things I stopped playing because the game became unstable. I waited for months and still nothing good has come from the patches. All the devs have done is unneeded nerfs, added a broken mana system, the game laggs far too much for it to even be playable. Yet they are already planning on adding another Act locked behind DLC.With all that said I just can't recommend this game to anyone anymore because clearly the Devs only cares about money. Just stay away from this game and never spend a dime on it not even if it was on sale. Don't support a dev team that doesn't know how they want the game to work and expects money to flow in. If you want to support a good game go get Grim Dawn at least it's stable and actually balanced.Update: Now the Devs are adding more character DLCs. The problem is that it costs $5 for each one. WHY? The Amazon character dlc is .99 cents so they have no reason to make the other character DLCs overpriced.Another thing is that I saw one of the devs post in the past that they couldn't add new content to the game after release. I call shenanigans because Terraria has been released for years and the devs still added new content to it long after release. Plus the devs keep changing the basic game mechanics so they have no reason to make this game have any DLC. The worst part of all is that you have to buy the DLCs if you don't you won't get any needed updates. As far as I see it I'm still calling this game a cash grab mess that shouldn't even be on Steam.As for the devs if they can't figure out how they want this game to work then they need to stop updating it and walk away. In all honestly I feel that the devs should stop making video games, because the other game they created was also bad. Just look at that games reviews and you will see it's just as much of a steaming pile as this game.I will say this again stay far away from this game and this dev team it's not worth wasting the money on it EVER!

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 28, 2015
												So after putting in a mere modest 12hs into the game I can now say that I did indeed have a blast of a time playing it thus far, and for anyone interested in binding of isaac or isometric arpgs its a pretty solid buy especialy for the current price point (roughly 10 euros for base game and the current 3 dlcs.).However and this is a big one, the game does come with its fair share of bugs and minor annoyances (having to port forward to even get multiplayer to work isn't something I was expecting of a game in this day and age.) but overall it didnt impact my gameplay all that much and I could still enjoy the game.Graphics : They are pretty much what you can expect from a rougeliteesque game going for a retro feel, Not a showstopper but they're pretty crisp and clear and get the job done for a game of this type. 7/10Audio : The skills have a pretty satisfying weight and sound behind them and the voice lines of champions are pretty stellar (altho they quite quickly start repeating themself and could lead to annoyance for some) the soundtrack itself isnt anything spectacular but not bad by any stretch of the imagination. 6/10Gameplay : This is your typical lootwh*re game, it does have some elements to spice things up in the form of dungeons and crypts that spawn inside the arena you're currently in, the dungeons and crypts come in different types and some might be a fairly straight forward miniboss and some loot while others contain puzzles and traps, in short if you enjoy hoarding loot and watching your character progress then this game will be pretty amazing and if you dont, why are you even here? 7/10Overall, I do recommend this game but only if you can live with the bugs, its a 6/10 alone but quickly becomes a 8/10 if you do have a friend or two (or three) to play it with.

content:
Posted: November 30, 2014
												Elements of Binding of Isaac mixed with a very, very watered down Diablo 2?/3 makes Hero Siege.+ Cheap game~ Graphics are clean, somewhat- Controls best with a controller unfortunately (I had a controller anyway, but still)- Getting hit with hard-to-notice-projectiles amongst the busy (sometimes VERY busy) graphics- Cheap deaths ranging from enemy's death shooting a laser to environmental traps- Simplistic and unimaginative skills (all classes have multiple "% to cast when attacking" skills)- Terrible netcode for multiplayer (Why have it in a DLC if it's so terrible?)- Levels are all the same with little variation- Stat levels you gain from levelling mean very little- "Relics" (which are items that grant different effects you carry with you) are mostly unimaginative stat boosts- Bosses that appear after 6 waves do not scale with # of waves and are completely boring/easy (although how boring fighting these bosses are, this may be a good thing)- The only break from monotony are dungeons/crypts which are deathtraps (see: environmental traps)- Grindy with little rewardIn summary: the game's exceedingly cheap deaths, repetitive gameplay, and banal character skill trees make this game very difficult to recommend to even the most autistic player.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 15, 2015
												There's difficulty, and then there's just poor design. This game falls in to the later. Projectiles will generally one shot you, or shave off a massive chunk of your health at the very least. Even an AoE DoT from one enemy type generally takes off over a quarter of my HP if it grazes me for half a second. Almost all deaths are nigh-instantaneous, with no chance for reaction or to learn from your mistakes.Additionally, the game seems to love to spawn certain bosses in a way that they will INSTANTLY kill you the moment they spawn in, with some attack where I have not even been able to determine what is HAPPENING, since I only get to see the boss for a fraction of a second.The levelling all seems to completely ignore generally accepted good game design policies, such as diminishing returns. All of the stats you can invest will make absolutely no noticeable difference at first, so early levels only make you feel any stronger from the talent trees. And many of the skills in the talent trees are incredibly poorly designed for early on as well, such as the pyromancer, which has many skills with a 1% chance per rank chance of triggering when you do a basic attack. So when you first grab the skill, it will basically never make any difference, but eventually, once you have levelled it up to be 100x stronger (since nothing seems to have any sort of diminishing returns?) it will also be triggering 100% of the time.I really wanted to enjoy this, because it looked like exactly the kind of game I had been looking for lately, but I have to say, this is one of the most disappointing purchases I have made on steam.

content:
Posted: January 30, 2016
												This game got me really excited, after playing for some time. At first it was a little bit difficult to get into the game, but I like it that you don't get everything pushed in your face. So I had a great time figureing out how the game works. After i understood how the death mechanic works and that you will lose all your relics on death, which are the most important items to boost your character, i got really excited. So in this game death gets punished, which is great. I had some exciting moments when i survived near death or some frustrating moments when i died and needed to start over. You keep your character (even though you can play a hardcore character), your level and your gold and will lose your keys (to open certain treasure chests) and your relics.I did find some minor bugs, but the devs are very active and releasing regulary patches. There are some DLC's which will 'complete' the game. With the basic game you can access 4 out of 7 acts and you can not play every character available. For now I find this way of handling the DLC's okay, because you can reach the max. level without the dlc's. Im not sure if the endgame content is limited to dlc users, but I will add this detail once i reached the max level (150). If you like Diablo you will enjoy this game as well. Just the fighting mechanics are kinda like in The binding of Isaac. The only drawbacks I've seen so far is that you can't access the control menu while beeing ingame and you can't access the list with the relics while beeing ingame, which would be useful to read what effect it has (if you couldn't read it while obtaining). So I ended up searching on the internet for the effect of relics and some weapon/armor effects which you can't look up in the game.And for whatever reason I can't get access to the Servers (living in germany). So I ended up playing on multiplayer alone with the peer2peer option, because i was too lazy to open the port. All in all I really enjoy this game so far!

content:

												This game is a lot of fun when playing singleplayer, even though it can be frustrating from time to time it is still addicting.On the other hand, we have multiplayer. One word that could describe this "pre-alpha" multiplayer is cancer. Here's why: - 90% of the particles (not including the projectiles) are not even visible by the 2nd, 3rd or 4th player, including the traps.- random player ability swaps (e.g. the 2nd player is a pirate and the host is a marksman, the ability glitch would make marksman's abilities the same as the pirates, for instance, the 'harpoon/balista trap' would be switched with the pirate's cross-looking trap- only host can open the treasure room doors- it can happen that when someone else other than the host enters the crypt/portal to the next biom? (after defeating the mini boss) the host becomes stuck on the place he spawns - the necromancers minions follow the host, so I wouldn't really count on minions help if you're away from the host- the vikings primary damage ability (the one in which he slams the ground which also stuns the monsters for a bit) is glitched most of the times (atleast that's for the players who aren't hosting), by that I mean that you don't actually deal damage, even if you should deal 1750 dmg, you would actually deal 300 dmg or 0 to monsters- there's probably still something that I have forgotten at this moment but you get the pointTL;DR:- bought the game since it was cheap, it actually is addictive when you play singleplayer, but multiplayer will get you frustrated- if you hate glitches, don't buy this game, period- even though the game has been out for over a year + you actually have to pay in order to play with your friends, the multiplayer could've been IMPROVED A LOT during this period, having people play multiplayer in a 'pre-alpha' stage after a year is quite

												DO NOT BUY THE DLC!!!!  OK. Now that I've got that out of the way... This game is great and I recommend it.  Easy to pick-up and fun to play.  The DLC however, simply doesn't work.  You can buy it, but not play it (at least I can't).  Multiplayer not working at this time (DLC was supposed to add that feature).
